data.price: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1],
data.footnotes: [1] Allah had given Quraysh the honor of being guardians of the Holy Ka‘bah, which allowed them to travel in peace without fear of being harmed.

data.price: secure in their winter and summer journeys[2].
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., their trading caravans would travel south to Yemen in winter and north to the Levant in summer.

data.price: Let them worship the Lord of this [Sacred] House[3],
Who fed them against hunger and made them secure against fear[4].
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
data.footnotes: [4] The people of Quraysh were blessed with provision and security probably because of the prayer of Abraham. See 14:35-37
